info.title: Sequences
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: You need to enroll them in a HubSpot sequence using an app you designed to maintain a list of contacts.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the Sequences API to get a list of sequences get a specific sequence, enroll a contact in a sequence, and view a contactâ€™s enrollment status.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of sequences for a user
get.description: Retrieve a list of sequences that belong to a specific user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user with read access on the sequences being retrieved.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A paging cursor token used to retrieve the next set of results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of sequences to return.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A parameter to filter sequences by their name.

post.summary: Enroll a contact in a sequence
post.description: Enroll a contact into a sequence using the specified user ID and sequence details.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user enrolling the contact in the sequence

get.summary: Retrieve the enrollment status of a contact
get.description: Get the enrollment status of a contact in sequences by their contact ID.

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the contact whose enrollment status in sequences is being retrieved.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific sequence by its ID.

parameters.name: sequenceId
parameters.description: The ID of the sequence to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The ID of the user with read access on the sequence being retrieved.

criteria.description: Specifies the unenrollment criteria for meetings booked, with accepted values being 'ALL' or 'NONE'.

sellingStrategy.description: Defines the unenrollment criteria for meetings booked, with accepted values being ACCOUNT_BASED or LEAD_BASED. If ACCOUNT_BASED, all other contacts at the same company will also be unenrolled.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the step dependency was created.

dependencyType.description: The type of dependency between sequence steps with accepted values being TASK_COMPLETION or MANUAL_PAUSE.

id.description: The unique identifier of the step dependency.

reliesOnSequenceStepId.description: The unique identifier of the sequence step that is responsible for creating and resolving this dependency.

reliesOnStepOrder.description: The order number of the step that is responsible for creating and resolving this dependency.

requiredBySequenceStepId.description: The unique identifier of the sequence step that requires this dependency.

requiredByStepOrder.description: The order number of the step that requires this dependency.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the step dependency was last updated.

criteria.description: Specifies the unenrollment criteria for email replies, with possible values of ALL or NONE.

sellingStrategy.description: Defines the unenrollment criteria applicable email replies to , with accepted values being ACCOUNT_BASED or LEAD_BASED. If ACCOUNT_BASED, all other contacts at the same company will also be unenrolled.

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

enrolledAt.description: The date and time when the contact was enrolled in the sequence.

enrolledBy.description: The identifier of the user who enrolled the contact in the sequence.

enrolledByEmail.description: The email address of the user who enrolled the contact in the sequence.

id.description: The unique identifier for the sequence enrollment.

sequenceId.description: The unique identifier of the sequence in which the contact is enrolled.

sequenceName.description: The name of the sequence in which the contact is enrolled.

toEmail.description: The email address of the contact enrolled in the sequence.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the sequence enrollment was last updated.

actionType.description: The type of action to be performed in the sequence step.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the sequence step was created.

delayMillis.description: The delay in milliseconds before the sequence step is executed.

id.description: The unique identifier of the sequence step.

stepOrder.description: The order of the step within the sequence.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the sequence step was last updated.

enrolledAt.description: The date and time when the contact was enrolled in the sequence.

id.description: The unique identifier for the sequence enrollment.

toEmail.description: The email address of the contact enrolled in the sequence.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the sequence enrollment was last updated.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the sequence was created.

folderId.description: The identifier of the folder containing the sequence.

id.description: The unique identifier for the sequence.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the sequence was last updated.

userId.description: The ID of the user associated with the sequence.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

createdAt.description: The date and time when the sequence was created.

folderId.description: The ID of the folder containing the sequence.

id.description: The unique identifier of the sequence.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the sequence was last updated.

userId.description: The ID of the user associated with the sequence.

total.description: The total number of sequences available.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the email pattern was created.

id.description: The unique identifier of the email pattern.

templateId.description: The unique identifier of the email template associated with the pattern.

threadEmailToStepOrder.description: The order identifying the previous step to which the email thread is linked.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the email pattern was last updated.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of when the sequence settings were created.

eligibleFollowUpDays.description: Specifies the days on which follow-up actions are allowed.

id.description: The unique identifier for the sequence settings.

individualTaskRemindersEnabled.description: Indicates whether individual task reminders are enabled.

sellingStrategy.description: (deprecated) Defines the unenrollment strategy, with accepted values being ACCOUNT_BASED or LEAD_BASED. If ACCOUNT_BASED is used, all contacts associated with the same company will be unenrolled if one contact meets any of the unenrollment criteria.

sendWindowEndMinute.description: Indicates the end minute of the time window during which automated emails can be sent.

sendWindowStartMinute.description: Indicates the start minute of the time window during which automated emails can be sent.

taskReminderMinute.description: Specifies the minute of day at which task reminders are triggered.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp of when the sequence settings were last updated.

contactId.description: The unique identifier of the contact to be enrolled in the sequence.

senderAliasAddress.description: The alias email address used by the sender when enrolling the contact.

senderEmail.description: The email address of the sender enrolling the contact in the sequence.

sequenceId.description: The unique identifier of the sequence in which the contact will be enrolled.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

NextPage.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

createdAt.description: The date and time when the task pattern was created.

id.description: The unique identifier for the task pattern.

notes.description: Additional notes or comments associated with the task.

queueId.description: The identifier for the queue associated with the task.

subject.description: The subject line of the task.

taskPriority.description: The priority level assigned to the task.

taskType.description: The type of task, such as an email or call.

templateId.description: The identifier for the template used in the task.

threadEmailToStepOrder.description: The order of the step to which the email thread is related.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the task pattern was last updated.

scopes.automation.sequences.enrollments.write: Permission to write sequences enrollments data
